title: The Airbnb cofounder who just became the US's chief design officer is using the Apple Store's style as his north star
description: Joe Gebbia says he wants to "update today's government services to be as satisfying to use as the Apple Store."
content: Joe Gebbia, a cofounder and former chief product officer of Airbnb, said on Saturday that President Donald Trump has appointed him as the US's first chief design officer."My directive is to update today's government services to be as satisfying to use as the Apple Store: beautifully designed, great user experience, run on modern software," Gebbia, 44, wrote in an X post.Representatives for Gebbia and the White House did not respond to requests for comment from Business InsiderOn Thursday, Trump signed an executive order that created Gebbia's new role and the National Design Studio. In his order, Trump said it is "time to fill the digital potholes across our Nation" and "update the Government's design language to be both usable and beautiful." The national initiative would be called "America by Design," he said.As part of the order, federal agency chiefs will have to consult with Gebbia on how to implement the initiative and "shall produce initial results by July 4, 2026."Gebbia told Axios it was "an injustice that our interfaces are horribly out of date." Government mobile apps and websites act as the "front door to the government" and should be as beautifully designed as platforms made by Apple and Airbnb, he said."There's no reason why our government can't be a standard for great design," Gebbia told Axios.Gebbia is no stranger to the Trump administration. In February, Gebbia said he was joining the White House DOGE office. He added that his first project at DOGE would be to improve the "slow and paper-based retirement process" for federal employees.Gebbia left his operational role at Airbnb in 2022 but continues to sit on its board of directors. He is also a Tesla board member.In an interview published Saturday, Gebbia told Axios that Cabinet members and other officials had asked him for help on "how to ship internet products at scale that are beautifully designed" while he was working at DOGE."I will do my best to make the US the most beautiful, and usable, country in the digital world," Gebbia said of his new appointment on Saturday.
summary: Joe Gebbia, a cofounder and former chief product officer of Airbnb, has been appointed as the US's first chief design officer by President Donald Trump. His role involves updating government services to be as satisfying to use as the Apple Store. The National Design Studio will be created under an executive order called "America by Design". Gebbian's first task will be to improve the retirement process for federal employees. He also stated that he will assist in creating the most beautiful, and usable, country in the digital world.
shortSummary: Joe Gebbia, a former Airbnb CEO, became the US's first chief design officer, aiming to create a seamless, user-friendly interface for government services.
argos_summary: Joe Gebbia, former Airbnb chief product officer, was appointed by President Donald Trump as the United States’ first chief design officer, tasked with modernizing government digital services under the “America by Design” initiative. The executive order requires federal agencies to consult with Gebbia and deliver initial results by July 4 2026, aiming to make government interfaces as user‑friendly and aesthetically pleasing as Apple or Airbnb. Gebbia has previously worked with the Trump administration on the DOGE office and plans to overhaul slow, paper‑based processes for federal employees. He emphasizes that government should set a standard for great design and user experience. His appointment follows his departure from Airbnb’s operational role in 2022, though he remains on its board.
